Clare_Dunn:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{about|the American country musician|people with similar names|Clare Dunne (disambiguation)}} {{for|the nun and Arizona state legislator|Clare Dunn (nun)}} {{Infobox musical artist | honorific_prefix = | name = Clare Dunn | honorific_suffix = | image = Clare Dunn at Bra Country Concert.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Clare Dunn in performance for Y100's Bra Country Concert on October 14th at the new "Backstage At The Meyer" in downtown Green Bay to benefit the Breast Cancer Family Foundation in 2015 | birth_name = | native_name = | native_name_lang = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1987|4|27}} | birth_place = | origin = [[Two Buttes, Colorado]], United States{{cite web |url=http://www.claredunn.com/my-story/ |title=My Story - Clare Dunn |website=www.claredunn.com |access-date=13 January 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170512135700/http://www.claredunn.com/my-story/ |archive-date=12 May 2017 |url-status=dead}} | death_date = | death_place = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|Guitar}} | years_active = 2013–present | label = [[MCA Nashville]]| | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|http://claredunn.com/}} }} '''Clare Dunn''' (born April 27, 1987) is an American [[Country music|country]] musician from southeast [[Colorado]].{{cite web|last1=Mansfield|first1=Brian|last2=Ryan|first2=Patrick|title=Clare Dunn, Raury among 2015's artists to watch|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2014/12/29/artists-to-watch-2015/20686419/|publisher=USA Today|accessdate=6 January 2015}} After support from satellite radio as a "Highway Find" on [[The Highway (Sirius XM)]], she signed with [[Universal Music Group Nashville]]{{cite web|last1=Nicholson|first1=Jessica|title=Universal Music Group Nashville Signs Clare Dunn|date=17 November 2014|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2014/11/universal-music-group-nashville-signs-clare-dunn/|publisher=Music Row|accessdate=6 January 2015}} and [[BMG Rights Management|BMG]]. She has opened for many notable country acts such as [[Florida Georgia Line]], [[Luke Bryan]], [[Bob Seger]], [[Chris Young (singer)|Chris Young]], [[Miranda Lambert]], [[Keith Urban]], [[Hank Williams Jr.]], and [[Trace Adkins]].{{cite web|last1=Bemiss|first1=Faith|title=Getting to know Clare Dunn|url=http://www.sedaliademocrat.com/news/home_top-news/50131599/Getting-to-know-Clare-Dunn|publisher=Sedalia Democrat|accessdate=6 January 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402110128/http://www.sedaliademocrat.com/news/home_top-news/50131599/Getting-to-know-Clare-Dunn|archive-date=2 April 2015|url-status=dead}} ==Career== After moving to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], Dunn sang backing vocals on [[Luke Bryan]]'s "[[Country Girl (Shake It for Me)]]".{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2015/06/30/clare-dunn-move-on-countrys-next-female-star/29489635/|title=Will 'Move On' make Clare Dunn a star?|last=Mansfield|first=Brian|date=June 30, 2015|work=[[USA Today]]|accessdate=7 November 2015}} Dunn released her debut single, "Get Out," on December 17, 2013, and subsequently became the highest charting independent female artist on the Music Row Country Breakout chart in ten years.{{cite web|title=Clare Dunn Becomes Highest Charting Independent Female Artist In 10 Years|url=http://www.nashville.com/music/2014/08/clare-dunn-highest-charting-independent-female-artist-in-10-years/|publisher=Nashville|accessdate=6 January 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141022112433/http://www.nashville.com/music/2014/08/clare-dunn-highest-charting-independent-female-artist-in-10-years/|archive-date=22 October 2014|url-status=dead}} She released her second single, "Cowboy Side of You," on August 11, 2014.{{cite web|title=Clare Dunn Achieves More Milestones With New Single, "Cowboy Side Of You," While On An Unconventional Career Path|url=http://www.nashvillemusicguide.com/2014/09/06/clare-dunn-achieves-more-milestones-with-new-single-cowboy-side-of-you-while-on-an-unconventional-career-path/|publisher=Nashville Music Guide|accessdate=6 January 2015|archive-url=https://archive.today/20150106232353/http://www.nashvillemusicguide.com/2014/09/06/clare-dunn-achieves-more-milestones-with-new-single-cowboy-side-of-you-while-on-an-unconventional-career-path/|archive-date=6 January 2015|url-status=dead}} Dunn was also listed by Sounds Like Nashville as one of the artists to watch for 2017 in country music.{{Cite news|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/lists/14-new-country-artists-to-watch-in-2017/|title=Sounds Like Nashville's 14 New Country Artists to Watch in 2017|date=2016-12-15|work=Sounds Like Nashville|access-date=2017-03-09|language=en-US}} Two more singles from her self-titled EP — "Move On" and "Tuxedo" — were released in 2015 and 2016, respectively, and both charted on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts. Dunn's fifth single to country radio, "More," was released on June 4, 2018. In March 2020 Dunn parted ways with [[MCA Nashville]].{{citation needed|date=June 2022}} In May 2020, it was announced that Clare has joined Big Yellow Dog Music and released "Safe Haven" on May 1, 2020.{{citation needed|date=June 2022}} A new single called "Salt and Lime" was released on May 22, 2020. ''Honestly: A Personal Collection EP'' was released on June 12, 2020, as her first release with Big Yellow Dog Music. ==Personal life== In June 2021, Dunn was assaulted by a [[Lyft]] driver in Nashville.{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/clare-dunn-assault-driver-arrested-1210227/ |date=2021-09-10 |first1= Jon |last1=Freeman |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |title=Lyft Driver Who Attacked Country Singer Clare Dunn Arrested}} ==Discography== === Extended plays === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart

Director |- | 2015 ! scope="row"| "Move On"{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/videos/clare-dunn/1235466/move-on.jhtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150906020700/http://www.cmt.com/videos/clare-dunn/1235466/move-on.jhtml|url-status=dead|archive-date=September 6, 2015|title=CMT : Videos : Clare Dunn : Move On|publisher=[[Country Music Television]]|accessdate=September 6, 2015}} | [[TK McKamy]] |- | 2016 ! scope="row"| "Tuxedo"{{cite news|title=Clare Dunn's "Tuxedo" Video Debuts On VEVO|url=http://www.umgnashville.com/news/clare-dunns-tuxedo-video-debuts-on-vevo/|accessdate=May 14, 2016|work=[[Universal Music Group Nashville]]|date=May 12, 2016}} | Kristin Barlowe |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dunn, Clare}} [[Category:American women country singers]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:MCA Records artists]] [[Category:Country musicians from Colorado]] [[Category:1987 births]] [[Category:21st-century American women]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Colorado]]
